Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: paprika
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location in Sultanahmet, easy to get around. The rooms are fairly small, but adequate. Staying a minimum of 3 nights, we were able to get one way airport pick up, so it was convenient. Asking the front desk about places or recommendations resulted in very little.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Arshad S
Reviews.Content: First impression wasn't very good, now they have changed the name so it was a nightmare for the taxi driver to find the hotel. It is ideally located, close walk to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, and also to tram station and good eateries nearby. However, the room we were given was on ground floor, and windows opened into the street. It was badly lit, very small and decor is very old, I was very much disappointed having paid a good price I was expecting a better room. Next day I was shifted to first floor, which was comparatively bigger size but still not very spacious. I wonder although you can get good decor items at very good price in Istanbul, still they don't change it. Some of the staff was very friendly and helpful, kudos to them. Breakfast was very good, and breakfast area on the terrace has a fantastic view.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: CorradoConforti
Reviews.Content: Been here for a 4 days business trip on november 2011. 2 minutes walk from the SultanHamet Camii, the Blue Mosque, in a historic residential quarter full of restaurants, shops and hotels. The hotel is a wooden 19th century building, really luxury in the turkish way. Excellent service, very good breakfast. The room was clean, luxury, with a wide bed, flat TV, free wifi, clean and good bathroom. I will stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maha A
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience at Hotel Obelisk and we cherish our stay there for 3 nights till this day. Its location, staff, clealiness, view and most of the all the breakfast was all too good. I stayed with my parents, Husband and kids and the hotel has added comfort to our stay at Istanbul. I have recommended this hotel to couple of friends and they all have had a wonderful experience. Its reasonable in price, very nicely and simple decorated and quite close to all the main attractions in Istanbul. I can never forghet having my breakfast sitting right next to Blue mosque.....It was a great stay...Thankyou Obelisk! we will surely come back to visit you. Inshallah

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Gbkhaund
Reviews.Content: BW Obelisk has a very coveted location, right in the middle of Sultanhamet from where you can walk easily to any of the historical spots that one visits Istanbul for .. From the terrace you get beautiful views of the Hagia Sofia, Blue mosque and a never tiring view of the Bosphorous ... Roms are nice and we got a suite which gave you a glimpse of the Marmara sea from the windows. One particular staff Tanjou who managed the terrace restaurant made it a memorable experience with his polite manners and simplicity. He is definitely an asset to this hotel. The rest of the staff at the restaurant also were very accommodating with help with my one year old's food requirements..wifi is free and has a good download speed... Breakfast was delicious and so was the food in the restaurant ... Overall it was an excellent stay. I gave it a 4 rating instead of a 5 as he room heating had issues for two nights.. Otherwise everything else was wonderful and I would definitely recommend this place...

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in the center of old city!”
Reviews.Author: Danu M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BW Obelisk hotel from December 26 until December 29. The hotel is a very nice hotel and they do have a very friendly and helpful staff. We arrived in Istanbul at 06.30 am from a 15 hours flight from Jakarta, and we went directly to the hotel, thought just to wait in the lobby until 09.00 am as our tour will began, and that we know the check in time is at 01.00 pm. But as I checking in, the friendly receptionist said that they are going to prepare the junior suite we booked and in the mean time we could have our breakfast. And just imagine how happy we were! The food is great, but it's almost the same everyday, not much variety, but it paid off with the great view of the Blue Mosque and the Marmara sea from the restaurant. The room is spacious, even with 4 persons inside. It is clean, and so the bathroom. You could have a free afternoon tea and cookies in the lobbby. And it also very great. What more, the location of the hotel is just minutes walk to the Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and the Grand Bazaar. If you want to go somewhere like in Taksim area, you just hop the tram line which run near the Blue Mosque. I definitely would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at Obelsik”
Reviews.Author: mahaamer
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Obelisk is one of the many fine things happened to us in Istanbul. It is located in the heart of the city and just a 5 minutes walk to most of the monumental places like Blue mosque, Grand bazar, Topkapi etc...The breakfast we had at the Hotel was a highlight and we loved it. The staff was polite and helpful. Overall its a great place to stay and too comfy as thr rooms were neat, tidy and airy. We will have no second thoughts about our stay next time in Istanbul...Highly recommended for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Marooka
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very easy to reach by Taxi. Note: Wherever you are staying in Sultan Ahmet you must have your Hotel's phone number ready. BTW, there is more than 8 Best Western hotels in the same area. Location is very near to Sultan Ahmet, Rooms are spacious, clean, beds are comfy. The only noise came from a nearby train that passes by every now & then. Lobby is not that impressive, breakfast is really amazing with all what you think about. Fresh honey, fresh orange juice...etc. Views of the marmara sea from the breakfast rooms are stunning. Staff is skilled, has got free wifi as most of istanbul hotels. Overall it was very good

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and check out the view”
Reviews.Author: Lucyck
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. My husband and I stayed here as part of a Rick Steves' "The Best of Istanbul in 7 Days" tour. The staff is very helpful and polite. The rooms are clean and airy. The breakfast is wonderful. The location is ideal for walking to all of the sights in the Old City. And, the tram stop is only a short walk away. One of our special memories took place at this hotel: The view of The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia from the restaurant is great during the day but it is stunning at night when these two building are lit up. We went up to take night shots of the buildings and decided to stay for a glass of wine. We sat at an outdoor table watching the ship traffic on the Bosphorus. Very few people happened to be at the restaurant at that time so we were able to enjoy the view of Istanbul from a very peaceful spot. All of a sudden, we heard the final call to prayer from the mosques. It was a truly "WOW" moment and one that will make us remember the magic of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia L
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a wonderful 5 days in Istanbul. This hotel is in a perfect location for exploring the sights of the old quarter such as the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. It is also not too far from the tram stop. The hotel is very comfortable - our room was large and airy and it is delightful to breakfast on the top floor which overlooks the sea. If weather permits one can sit outside on the terrace. The staff were helpful and a nice touch was complimentary tea and cakes in the afternoon. Walls were a little thin, but that is the only negative I can think of!

Reviews.Title: “Central to Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Hotel Obelisk to be a wonderful place from which to explore Istanbul. The hotel is just downhill from the Blue Mosque, and the tram line leading to many points of interest. Booking our rooms via the internet was a breeze, thanks to the assistance of manager Hgur, who became a great source of information upon our arrival. The rooftop restaurant provides inspiring views of both the Blue Mosque and the waters surrounding Istanbul. Overall a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: deejayrussia
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in October of 2011. The staff was extremely helpful. We found this hotel through trip advisor and booked it through otel.com for the best price. It is quiet and the ambiance is wonderful. Nice breakfast view on the top floor. The staff helped us book a tour we had been offered somewhere else, and they called to make sure our car would pick us up to get the the airport in the early morning hours. The staff was always pleasant and kind. The maid service was good and the maid was very sweet. The room always looked wonderful upon returning from a day out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: NoPulp
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very near to the main tourist attractions (blue mosque and Hagia Sofia). The staff was very helpful from the beginning and they helped us when we wanted to book a boat trip to Princes' Islands. Air conditioner saved us from the heat and our room was generally ok, even though the walls were a bit thin. Maybe the best thing in hotel was roof terrace. We really enjoyed eating breakfast while watching Sea of Marmara at the same. They should definitely do something for crows, pigeons and other birds that were scavenging leftovers every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Beware this!”
Reviews.Author: faircourt
Reviews.Content: It was OK at first. Though we had relatively noisy sounds in the early morning from neighboring religious institutions. Breakfast was fine. However, we did have very unpleasant experiences when we asked the person at reception desk to call a taxi to visit another place. As I could not talk Turkish language, I asked the person to explain the destination to the driver. Before we get on the taxi, I reconfirmed the destination with the person. However, one hour later the taxi dropped at the airport! The airport was way opposit to the original direction. Puzzled and frustrated, I called the hotel at the airport. But hotel people just repeated statement that they did give a right direction to the driver. The driver barely spoke English. With some help by a bystander, the driver told us he was instructed to go the airport. While the hotel people just refused to take any responsiblity at all, we were stranded at the airport with a driver who could not speak English. The poor driver finally offerred to take us to the original place for free. So we got on the taxi again. As an attorney with much expericences, I thought the driver was an honest man. He even offered me five lira for using my phone to talk to the hotel person. Of course we paid some money to him when we got off though he refused to accept at first because we did not want to put him in big trouble thinking of his family.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dilruba786
Reviews.Content: This was our first family visit to Istanbul, having visited other parts of Turkey before. The Hotel is so inviting and lovely from the first time you set eyes on it. The receptionists are all very friendly and helpful. The Buffet Breakfast in the morning was splendid too, eating on the balcony looking at the Blue Mosque was an awesome sight. Most of the Major attractions are virtually 5-10 minutes away, including Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia. The food around our Hotel was great too, however the waiter outside tend to be a bit pushy wanting your trade. We would definitely recommend this Hotel and of course Istanbul, which is virtually as modern as most of the cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “whirlwind ......”
Reviews.Author: vumaas
Reviews.Content: Great location , near all major attractions, restaurants & pubs. This was an extremely compacted 2 day tour where we saw as much as possible in 2 days as is humanly possible, so not much time was spent in the hotel. That said the rooms were more than adequate but if you are a light sleeper could be a little noisy. Breakfast was good on the terrace with incredible views The staff were very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Charming with a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelling_to_eat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of a group of hotels located along the same street. My room was spacious, nicely decorated, and air conditioned. The location is great for walking around sultanahmet. The included breakfast buffet was the most "American" I have had in Turkey in a delicious way.

Reviews.Title: “Choose it if you want to walk round the Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hel0410
Reviews.Content: Great location with nice view of both - the Mosque ant the Bosphorus. Unfortunatelly, not from our room but from the restraurant it's awesome. We enjoyed the breakfast looking at the gulf. Btw, there was plenty of choice no matter when you come - at the beginning or at the very end of the breakfast. One special word about bed linen - it was so soft! And clean - so, our special thanks to the laundry ladies. A little bit expensive but it's worth this money. The staff is really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: SandMan242424
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine for the price â€“ clean and convenient, with nice-sized rooms and a great rooftop terrace â€“ but what really made our visit special was the staff. Sinon Gam at the front desk was very helpful, and the friendly staff at the terrace restaurant made it a pleasure to be there, either for the free breakfast or for afternoon/evening cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Can I return for a month stay???”
Reviews.Author: WitEWriter
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect Istanbul experience - my first visit and it was a easy, short brick road walk to amazing mosques, grand bazaar, restaurants, museums. The prayer calls and the hospitality - GREAT. We had a deluxe double - nice shower (big step in) and very comfy bed. The BEST breakfast, security, service, air conditioning, and view from the roof. AND FREE WIFI. I stayed her and toured for the first four days and then checked into a luxury 5 star hotel for business meetings. It was such a let down after the Best Western Obelisk (at the 5 star no breakfast, 15 EURO a day for WiFi, and a 28 TL ride to the historic part of the city). This hotel was more comfortable - better all around. Any downside would be the very small (but charming) elevator and the need to take stairs to get in the hotel and a small flight to the breakfast room. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff honoring turkisk hospitality, very good location and cooking,a charming hotel adress to keep in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Fadila7
Reviews.Content: So many hotels in Istanbul, but if you choose the Obelisk Hotel (Best Western), I think you will not be disappointed as this hotel provides wonderful accommodation: - First, by the kindness of its staff at the restaurant with notably Kazim who has a remarkable sense of service that reflects his great professionalism: breakfast / buffet, complimentary snacks in the afternoon and meals in the evening are great qualities: (felicitations to the cooks) also at the reception with the whole team listening customers very well especially Ugur, Sinon Jamalidinou and young lady. - Then, by the remarkable view from the roof - terrace of the hotel on the Marmara Sea, the beautiful mosques, and a part of the Istanbul city. - Also the location of the hotel in the heart of old Istanbul (Sultanahmet), 2 steps from the Blue mosque and Sainte Sophia mosque (radiating on the day and light at night) we had the luck to admire from the window of our room. Staying there for 9 days, on may/ june 2011, was a real delight and was important in the success of our holidays in Istanbul. Overall and to conclude, by staying here, we have made the right choice (maybe, the best choice ...) because we have found, not only, a charming hotel, true to the description on the Internet and even better because all the staff is welcoming with a family dimension, and the hotel is comfortable, clean and central. My opinion is that Obelisk Hotel (Best Western) approaches the "excellence", so this is an address that I keep for a future trip in Istanbul and communicate around me. Fadila Belmahdi (Paris)

Reviews.Title: “Definately Not a 4*”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while venturing Istanbul. Although we didn't have a bad experience as such, the hotel is definitely not a 4*. As with most other hotels in Sultanahmet the lobby was non existent and the whole place was on the dark side. Staff how ever were friendly and hospitable. The room reflected the same theme, Old, dated and dark with dark furnishing. As we hardly spent any time in the room it did not matter to us. It was also on the small side. The biggest issue is that the walls are paper thin and you can hear every, knock, bang, conversation, toilets flushing and even the cups being stacked at breakfast so if you are a light sleeper then be warned, luckily for us as we did so much during the day we simply passed out. The breakfast was average and was dominated by pastries and cakes the hot food was not to our liking and certainly not that of a 4* Hotel as one would expect. On the positive side the location is superb right by Blue Mosque and can walk to most places with out the need for map or guidance. It has free wifi which was fast and the hotel like Istanbul was clean All in all its a 2* or 3* at best and and if advertised as that with the price to reflect the it would have definitely got the 4* rating. I don't often give poor reviews but feel I owe this to TA as it has helped immensely over the past years.. So don't be put off by it just have that expectation if booking.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: MFrank611
Reviews.Content: From the time I arrived to the time I left, everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was clean with a nice view of the Bosphorus. The free breakfast bar had a wide variety of items from which to choose--breads, honey, jams, butter, cheese, olives, granola, yogurt, etc. While the dinner menu doesn't offer a large number of items, what it does offer is tasty and presented well. The service is friendly. The view from the rooftop restaurant is amazing! The hotel is a short walk from many of the important sites in the old part of the city. Very convenient. When I corresponded with the hotel to make my reservations, I received a quick response. I appreciated the fact they understood English--since my Turkish is very limited. Sinan and the others at the front desk were very helpful and always professional. Aziz was always willing to lend a hand with suitcases or to offer a cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly staff, Good facilities”
Reviews.Author: HammerGazzar
Reviews.Content: Hotel in very good location near to key tourist sites in Sultanhamet. Lots of restaurants nearby. Roof terrace very nice for breakfast in morning and for relaxing on in early afternoon after doing the tourist trails. Room was well appointed and clean. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to experience Turkish hospitality, stay at the Obelisk.”
Reviews.Author: Fari186338
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Obelisk for one week, between 15 - 22 may. The hotel is close to all the tourist sites. The Hotel staff were exteremly helpfull and knowledgable. The resturant manager (kazim) served wonderfull breakfasts, He also cooks the most delightfull "seabass" for dinner, try it with the shepard salad, You will never forget it. Give yourself an extra treat and use the SPA facilities, Let Ingrid take all your stresses away by giving you a fantastic massage in the Turkish Hamam. Thank you all for making our holiday so lovely. David & Fari Dear

Reviews.Title: “Ugur Yilmaz is great!”
Reviews.Author: DNP01
Reviews.Content: Me and 3 friends came to Istanbul to watch the F1. The hotel is excellent, location is good, very clean rooms, breakfast is decent. the staff at reception are excellent, especially Ugur. Ugur was happy to help with anything and went beyond expectations to ensure we had an excellent trip to Istanbul. The area is very safe. Staff were the highlight as was the cleanliness of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Not so good service”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer77_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very central and room was of a good standard. Staff at reception were great but those on door were surley and in restaurant seemed disinterested. Fixed menu is very poor so eat elsewhere. Overall don't think it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tim070
Reviews.Content: My stay in this hotel was very cozy. The service and the room was absolutly fine. The hotel is excellent located. The stuff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was plentiful at the roof top restaurant and with a beautiful view. I enjoyed it a lot. I can recommend this hotel for your next stay in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Roberto1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Obelisk Hotel in the Old Town to see what it was like. It is well located for those wishing to visit Istanbul. The rooms were large, but not cheap, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast on the roof was good with a good choice. Coffee was machine provided, not the best, but drinkable. Staff very helpfull, providing you don't need to leave very early. Well worth it if you are visiting The Mosques and surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--hands down!”
Reviews.Author: Fly_girl226
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel! We stayed a total of 8 nights--4 on the front end and 4 on the back end. The rooms were spotless and very spacious. The staff was quite friendly and most helpful. The included breakfast buffet was a feast--many selections of breads, eggs, meats, cheeses, greens, juices, teas and coffee. Kazim Ayranci kept the rooftop restaurant spotless and the buffet tables loaded with food and all this with a smile on his face! This hotel and its wonderful staff is an unbelievable value--you can't go wrong if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “charming and efficient hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: libbymew21
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel recently and were most impressed. Small, intimate, spotlessly clean, with charming and helpful staff (in particular Sinon Gamon on the reception desk). The location could not be better, but for us the highlight was the most perfect view imaginable of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop restaurant, and when it is floodlit at night it is a sight to die for. A very delightful plus point in this hotel is the complimentary tea buffet (delicious home baked cakes and biscuits plus tea, coffee and fruit juice) served in the lounge area every day from 3-6 pm - most welcome. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - it is quite charming.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Friendly and Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Lightbulb007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central to Old Istanbul, its on a street that is lined with restaurants, so makes dining easy. There is a Travel Shop close by too, that is super friendly and will be able to explain local places and trips. The Hotel staff are very helpful, especially Sinan, and on arrival gave me maps, and explained trips/excursions, booked airport transfers etc. There is free internet, and if you can make sure you get the breakfast, it was a huge selection of both western style food and Turkish, and the view is awesome. Whilst I was there it snowed, but it was amazing. I would definitely stay there again, and only wished I had been able to stay longer. You cant go wrong if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to be, if you wanna be in next to the best sightseeing Points!”
Reviews.Author: Girlstrip2011March
Reviews.Content: We sayed in the Hotel for 7 days. We had a perfect room overlooking the Bosporus. The room was clean and nicely furnished. The Housekeepin attendant was very kind and fast. the breakfast is very various. They do offer typical turkish food and also international as Omelett, pancakes usw... The Service was very helpful, unique and amazingly friendly. The whole staff was nice, helpful and always friendly, but especially Kazim Ayranci from the restaurant. The Restaurant ist also overviewing the Bosporus - AMAZING! It is a five minuite walk to the blue mosche and the hagia sophia aswell as the tram. Perfect location for sightseeing. A lot of trouble during the day, you can easily be the first at the topkapi palace in the morning and quiet in the evening. Super: complimentary wather in the room and free WIFI. The only thing i would apprecciate is an amenity of the hotel if you stay for one week (maybe a complimentary use of the spa or a reduction on a massage....) We definately recommend the hotel if you are looking for a practicly and clean hotel and if you would like to be in the middle of sulthanament1 we will returne, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “well located but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: oponthus
Reviews.Content: The door of my room to the corridor was not noise proof enough.

Reviews.Title: “Personable, possessional and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Wayfaringstranger18
Reviews.Content: Despite the incredibly convenient location, comfortable room and lounge, and free wifi I would have to say the incredibly personable staff is the standout feature of the Obelisk. Consistently they were the very model of attentive service, going out of their way to take care of us. Special mention goes to Sinan, who simply went above and beyond for his guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Obelisk41
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful - a great price during "off-season", and very convenient to many touristic sites in Sultanahmet, old town Istanbul. Rooms were small, but clean and had all amenities. A nice buffet breakfast. Staff was courteous and helpful, especially Sinan at the front desk. A fantastic view from the breakfast room on the third floor of the waterfront. Hotel is small, only three floors, so it is quite "intimate" in its feel. Close to tram and other public transport. Note that there was no business center, as it was quite small. The fitness center wasn'r really a fitness center, but a spa, where one had to pay for services. No frills, but very nice and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a superb view from the terrace”
Reviews.Author: martymorell
Reviews.Content: I often stop over in Istanbul in the course of business trips to/from points farther east, and the Best Western Obelisk in Sultanahmet (not to be confused with other Best Westerns in the same neighborhood) is my first choice. Breakfast on the terrace -- with a stunning view of the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmara on one side, equally impressive views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia on the other -- is an unforgettable experience. On my most recent visit I was accompanied by my wife and daughter, and although the triple provided was small, it was quite comfortable. Minor drawbacks were the lack of enough electrical outlets to accommodate our two computers and my daughter's numerous gizmos that needed charging, and also the fact that the tap water in the neighborhood is not recommended for drinking. However, plenty of bottled water is available. The bathrooms are well appointed and the showers work properly. Free WiFi is provided. The hotel is close to the main tourist attractions and also to the "restaurant row" on Yeni Akbiyik Caddesi. The staff, and particularly the manager Sinan, are invariably, and genuinely, friendly and welcoming. All in all, a great place for either a short or a more extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home base for exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PamCyc
Reviews.Content: We were picked up from the airport, which was awesome as we were travelling with a 10 month old. The staff was very helpful and the room was very large. More than enough room for my husband and myself as well as a playpen for our son. Room was clean and in great condition. Breakfast at the rooftop terrace was amazing and the veiews were great. You are very close to The Blue Mosque and Hague Sophia, but still just far enough away that call to prayer was not too disturbing. Loved Istanbul and this was a great place to see it from,as running back to the room durning the day was not unreasonable. Air Condition was also a blessing, though it would have been nice if it could have stayed on while we were out.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to explore unÄ±que Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: asien67
Reviews.Content: Hotel obelÄ±x was a great place to stay, super frÄ±endly staff , spacÄ±ous ,clean and complete room, glorÄ±ous breakfast wÄ±th beautÄ±ful vÄ±ew to the ocean and to blue mosque(mÄ±nus only for the coffee- nescafe seems to be standard Ä±n hotels) we were even lucky ,because we get a uprated room wÄ±thout payÄ±ng more, just because Ä± send a frÄ±endly e-maÄ±l Ä±n tyrkÄ±sch Ä±n advance !So we wÄ±ll book Hotel ObelÄ±sk agaÄ±n even the ;HÄ±ppodrome, nearby and same owner was makÄ±ng a very good Ä±mpressÄ±on to us... so have a nÄ±ce tÄ±me Ä±n Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Istanbul from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjzinck
Reviews.Content: Jan.2 to the 4th might not be the best time to visit, but this hotel was top notch in all categories. Loved the location-near all you wanted for a short stay. Resurants nearby are excellent: (Ocean's 7) was a great experience. Rooms are small compared to North American ones. We weren't in NA so didn't want a familiar setting. Got what we paid for and were extremely happy. The breakfast was complete with good slections.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Elmaz
Reviews.Content: Triple room was small and the third bed did not look double, but we were upgraded to junior suite at no extra charge. Location is ideal and staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Best staff, Location and Services”
Reviews.Author: Rana_Adeel
Reviews.Content: My trip was a short 3 day trip so I intended to stay in a place that should be in close proximity to the historical and cultural venues. So out of few choices I mapped on Google Earth; I opt for Best Western's Obelisk hotel. Another reason is its lesser price range than others. From the first instance, Obelisk staff impressed me and this impression gradually increased. Through out the whole trip they sincerely and correctly advice us events, places, functions, cruises and restaurants. I am personally thankful to Mr. Yasar Bolat and Dundar Guram who went out of way to show us the right way to explore the city where an anonymous tourist can't go without a an experienced tip. They have good contacts with all the major touring facilitators. Another attraction that I still missed is its rooftop restaurant from where an amazing view of Bosphorous bay is visible. Watching and capturing sunrise from east was a view that brought romance and colors. Location of Obelisk is closer to many Byzantine/ Ottoman landmarks and Marmara beach. All we wanted was a few minutes walk to explore such places. Obelisk area is also few steps away from rail station, tram and bus stops. Obelisk will be my same choice on next excursion of Istanbul as well.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel if you enjoy a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: dianamichael_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Obelisk for 5 days, 4 nights in January 2011. We chose the hotel after reading multiple reviews. The reviews (almost all very positive) were very misleading. Upon arrival to the hotel the staff was very helpful with grabbing our luggage and leading us to our room. We booked a double but were given two twins due to a lack of available rooms. We were thankfully given a double room the following day but this issue should not have occurred in the first place. The towels in our first bathroom were dirty, with bits of soap and hair stuck on the hand towels. We also had a problem with ants, which the staff asked if we wouldn't mind keeping the ants until the morning so that someone else could help with the problem. When we asked if they had bug spray or cleaning material so that we could clean it myself they replied that they had no cleaner at the time. The walls of the hotel are paper-thin. From toilets flushing to phone calls and late night conversations, you could hear EVERYTHING that went on in the hotel. Many reviews claimed the breakfast was amazing, but we found the breakfast to be just average with no exceptional qualities (minus the rooftop view of the nearby sights). Service-wise (apart from the insect issue) the hotel was only average. The information they gave to us was the mainstream tourist traps with nothing really personal. The location is great if you are looking to stay in the tourist area (Sultanahmet) but it is one of about a hundred other hotels in the same location. For food and night activities we would recommend staying in the Beyoglu neighborhood across the river opposed to Sultanahmet. Overall, we would not stay here again. The value is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Service Extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: Peacock41
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, close to all the main attractions in the historical centre, with all the modern comforts of a home away from home. Yasar Bolat at the front desk is fantastic - he was friendly, professional and really made a difference to the quality of our trip in Istanbul. His suggestions for things to do/places to see were spot on and he was always available and willing to help!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: mey27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. the hotel is in a great location within walking distance of the main attractions around sultanahmet district. The room was clean and good value for money. However when foggy we were disturbed and woken by the fog horn. However we thought the sauna and steam room was free to guests however it wasnt, if you wanted to use it you had to pay so we didnt use the sauna and steam room which was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: criss6952
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean, large rooms, rich breakfast with a view to the sea, good position; friendly and competent staff (special thanks to Mr. Sinan!)

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: LondonBubbles28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Obelisk for 8 nights, with some more friends arriving at a later date. I have to say that we were alll looked after very well and everything was catered for. The hotel is charming and the rooms are clean although a little bit small. The beauty of this hotel is the terrace, the view is beautiful and the room has a nice, light and airy feel to it. The view of the blue Mosque from the terrace was amazing. There is a spa downstairs but it was not in use when we were there so unfortunately we did not get to test it out. The hotel is close to all sights, but in a back street so away from all the noise. However, the walls are a bit thin so you can hear alot, that goes on and sometime you can get woken up early by the noise in the corridors. The cakes for breakfast were amazing. The staff were helpful especially Erdem,Ugur and Omer who went out of their way to ensure our stay was comfortable and that we got the most out of our trip there. Anything we asked for was arranged with ease. So thank you :-) Apart from the small issues -( ie thin walls, small rooms) my overall experience of the Best Western Obelisk was a very good one and i would definately reccomend this hotel to others. Thank you for everything Omer and staff. Sadiya

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: catDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from 9th Dec part of an organised tour with VJV. The weather when we stayed was dreadful- bitterley cold -snow and rain but this Hotel was always warm to come back to with plenty of hot water. The room we stayed in was comfortable with kettle ,some free bottles of water daily and air con if you needed it. It is in a perfect location for visiting many of the major sights either as part of a tour or an independant traveller and within easy walking distance to many restaurants for eating out. There is also a couple very close by plus a shop. Breakfast was fairly limited but i don't think you would go hungry and the views from this restaurant are superb. The Hotel itself is quite 'charming' in character. Unless you want one of the very big plush chain Hotels i would say this one would be a very good choice

Reviews.Title: “thank you Burcu”
Reviews.Author: AgnesBernandine
Reviews.Content: everything about the hotel was wonderful. My husband and 2 adult children stay there from sept28, to oct 1st. The staff was always helpful and friendly especially the front dest clerk BURCU. we had rented a mini van to drive to Kalkan, we had great difficulty with the rental agent, it wasn't his fault. just miscommunication Burcu spent great time and effort to help us clear things up. Always she was polite efficient and understanding. The hotel location is excellent. we would step out the front door and could walk anywhere. visitors do not want to take a chance driving there unless you are used to the formula one circuit.lwe walked everywhere ,haji sofia, Blue Mosque, bazaar the cistern. restaurants. shops, fantastic./ the tram was also close and conventint.. i cannot say enough good things about the hotel staff city and citiziens. it was an exceptional vacation. the rooms were exceptional, clean comfortable, turkish.. we loved it. I would go back there and stay again. and i hope we do,,,Istanbul is awake even into the very early morning hours. coffee tea beeer. conversation everyone speaks english and make you feel welcome. except the car rental agent and once again it was not his fault... cecelia

Reviews.Title: “a Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Teemah
Reviews.Content: Our stay at BWO was very pleasant! The day starts with a variant breakfast offered by the hotel for free. During the breakfast or afterwards, the cleaning staff would enter the room and tidy it. As for the breakfast, the food was delicious. They refilled the dishes whenever they got empty. There are tables inside and in the balcony. The view is quite beautiful, if you sit outside you could see the sea, and some of the houses nearby. Beds are very comfortable and their linens were soft and clean. The hotel is quite so you could sleep soundly without difficulty. Our room had a huge window that stretched from wall to wall. We would open the curtain in the morning and the room would lighten up. The bathroom is ok. There are both hot and cold water all the time. Water pump is very good too. We faced a mini problem during out stay though. There were ants in the bathroom. But other than that everything was great. The hotel has a Turkish bath which looks amazing. Unfortunately I didnâ€™t try it because we only checked it out in our last day at our stay. During our stay, there was a black out in Istanbul. It lasted for a few hours only, but it didnâ€™t bother us at all since the hotel has an emergency generator.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: siba1997
Reviews.Content: In brief, Hotel Obelisk is fabulous: Excellent location, great breakfast and free internet. I, my wife and my two teenage daughters stayed there for 8 days in November 2010 .We were very pleased. Great terrace to enjoy breakfast. We were completely satisfied with the staff treatment as well as the rooms, the cleanness, and the breakfast. We were really comfortable, the staff was helpful, and the morning manger Mr. Sinan was very kind, helpful and answered all our questions. There was a good lobby with couches and one computer with free internet access and free internet anywhere in the hotel. The breakfast buffet that was included with our room rate was an exceptional value. Lots of food choices and a great way to start your day. It was very pleasant to start the day with the warm and peaceful smile of Ms. Batool and Mr. kathem .The breakfast area also had a nice terrace with excellent unobstructed views of the sea and on the back side a great view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. From the Obelisk you're within very easy walking distance to the main sites in the Sultanahmet area like the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Sistern and Topkapi Palace. This is the tourist area, so on the walk you'll encounter a fair share of carpet and traditional Turkish art item stores and restaurants with sellers trying to get you to stop in. But if you have the right attitude, the shopkeepers will become like your friends after a while and they'll greet you with a hearty smile and hello whenever they see you pass by. It is a very solid hotel and an excellent value.I must mention an additional strong point: during our stay, Sultanahmat district had electricity blackout for 5 hours. The hotel has an emergency generator which started immediately. the air-condition was on but the lift did not work obviously because the generator cannot support it. Finally ,Having read the previous reviews by other guests: I believe that the hotel administration has managed to deal with one complain, the breakfast stayed on the buffet till 10:00 AM

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: evan444
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of Istanbul's Old Town area. Clean rooms, excellent customer service and a location that can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great location, Quiet pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: D_Lyted
Reviews.Content: Thank you Siron and the staff! We had a great 2 night stay! The room was comfortable, quiet and a 5 min walk to the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and Topkapi. The morning included breakfast was bountiful. We would stay here again. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “great service, comfortable, and great location”
Reviews.Author: bwaller1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable and the staff was very helpful. In particular, Mehmet at the front desk helped me with tours, resataurants, and transportation. He was helpful, knowledgeable, and made my vacation more successful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdafer
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great staff especially Sinan who went out of his way to give us information. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who's interested in sightseeing. One word "wonderful Istanbul"

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MPP48
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the size of the rooms, compared to Paris hotels it was great! The staff was very helpful and nice, I was impressed by their willingness to help. The room was very clean. The only fault is that the walls seemed to be a bit thin, I used ear plugs after the first night. There is not a lot of streeet noise so that was good, at least not until after 6 AM. The noise came from the plumbing system. But with ear plugs I was able to sleep. It was worth using earplugs for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money, would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: tatarakis
Reviews.Content: Finally, I got, not only what I paid for, but much more. I never found it easy to book through the internet and was disappointed many times, but not this time, the staff was great, it would be unfair to single one person out, from the duty manager to the house keeper, they were all accommodating, always with a smile, just terrific. The room we stayed in (312) was surprisingly large and tastefully designed, and kept spotless throughout our stay, breakfast is not the most exotic, but trust me, you will find all the necessary and basic Items i.e. coffee, tea, juices, cereal eggs, cold cuts and cheeses, vegetables, olives and chese pies, it is a good spread served on the roof of the hotel with a nice view of the bosphorus, the blue mosque and Agia Sophia. Location is great, just 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia, and the Grand Bazaar. That is all I can say, we were satisfied with the hotel and had a great Holiday. M.tatarakis / Crete

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, Good locatÄ±on. Worth the money ...........”
Reviews.Author: SPadmanDubai
Reviews.Content: RevÄ±ews of many hotels Ä±n the old town part of Istanbul spoke about small rooms, noÄ±sy trams etc. We therefore looked at several hotels before bookÄ±ng at the BW ObelÄ±sk. We booked a 'SuperÄ±or' room to ensure we had a wÄ±ndow to look out. We were gÄ±ven a room on the Ground Floor whÄ±ch was dÄ±sappoÄ±ntÄ±ng, the vÄ±ew from the wÄ±ndow was to the bck of the hotel, used to store unused furnÄ±ture. But, the room was clean, decent sÄ±ze and comfortable. We dÄ±d not bother about the vÄ±ew as we spent most of the day outsÄ±de anyway. Many revÄ±ews of the ObelÄ±sk hotel talk about 'rude' staff. We dÄ±d not experÄ±ence any problems. Staff were courteous and helpful. Perhaps, the best thÄ±ng about thÄ±s hotel Ä±s locatÄ±on. It Ä±s very close (as are several other Best Western Hotels lÄ±ke Acropal) to the attractÄ±ons lÄ±ke TopkapÄ± Palace, SaÄ±nt SophÄ±a, etc. But one bÄ±g dÄ±fference Ä±s that Ä±t Ä±s one street away from the rest of the hotels, and fortunately a quÄ±eter one that has no traffÄ±c. Breakfast Ä±s free but nothÄ±ng to rave. Average qualÄ±ty, I wÄ±sh they served better juÄ±ce though

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: cuilla
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of almost all tourist destinations. Roof patio with a view of the Blue Mosque, the Bosphorus Strait and the Asian side of Istanbul. The rooms was cozy and clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. All of our requests were met and exceeded by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “General”
Reviews.Author: marchingant077
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff, especially Sinan were very helpful especially when I was ill and needed to find a chemist. They went beyond normal service which was greatly appreciated. The hotel was clean and the bed was comfortable. The air conditioning was adequate and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Resturant but RUDE front of house staff”
Reviews.Author: JimB0ne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in August 2010 to visit the sights of Istanbul for which it is ideally located close to the main sights in Sultanahmet. The hotel is finished to a good standard and in a nice building. The highlight of the hotel is the restaurant on the top floor which overlooks the sea at one end and the blue mosque the other; this is where an excellent breakfast is served. We also ate a meal here on the first evening, taking advantage of the 20% discount for guests on the first night- the sea bass was very good and the serving staff friendly though the wine a little expensive. We did have some major issues with the hotel the main being the rudeness of some of the front of house staff especially a Mr [-] who consistently failed to acknowledge us and was very abrupt despite us staying in the hotel for 5 nights. The seconds and more minor point is that the Turkish bath is not included and costs 10 Euros- this appears to lead to the bath not being used and when looking at the facility it appeared to be used as a storage area. The free wifi is present but the signal was too weak to connect in our room on the 3rd floor. The air-conditioning was also poor in our room compared to other hotels we stayed in Turkey. The cleaning staff also had an annoying habit of cleaning your room while at breakfast so when you return to pick up your things to go out for the day you would get in their way. Overall I would recommend staying in the area where the hotel is situated - but not staying in the Obelisk unless it improves its customer service. There are definitely hotels with similar facilities in the area that would be pleased to have your custom.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ninitaly
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel provided you get a good deal on the price, as I am sure there are better places to stay in the area (Sultanahmet). What I didn't like: - the air/con broke down a few times overnight and was generally very bland. Coom areas (i.e. corridors and breakfast room) were *not* air/coned. Istanbul in August is extremely hot and humid, so air/con tends not to be an option if you want to get some sleep - breakfast room was very messy and tables were often not cleaned/cleared properly - the staff was often pushy in trying to get tips from us What I did like: - good location for sightseeing and restaurants (although these tend to be very touristy so I would still recommend moving away from this area for food) - room was spacious and fairly clean - free wi-fi (although you will find this is available absolutely *everywhere* in Turkey)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, amazing roof terrace, fun rooms”
Reviews.Author: zelenas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all we could have asked for. It was our first time in Istanbul, so staying close to all the must-see tourist sites was perfect. The roof terrace where we had breakfast every morning was fantastic. We also had a pleasant (although somewhat expensive, as typical in this part of town) dinner there the first night (the hotel gives 20% discount for the night you arrive). The front desk staff was very polite and friendly and helpful - Sinan made good recommendations for tours.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: spiderkitties
Reviews.Content: As others have commented, the hotel is within minutes of walking distance to the top sights in Old Town, and also an easy walk to the street car. Our room was spotless, comfortable, quiet and fairly spacious. The AC worked fine for our room. The hotel also provides free email access. The breakfast served in the rooftop restaurant is a real treat with a wide assortment of delicious items. The hotel is located in a lively neighborhood which gets going after dark. There are a lot of casual and upscale restaurants, cafes and bars to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “A good standard, but bad airconditioner and no warmht at the reception desk!”
Reviews.Author: globereporter
Reviews.Content: We had some good and relaxing days at the hotel. The top teracce has an excellent standard, both with its breakfast buffet and later during the day as a restaurant. You can sit outside in the sun or in the shadow under the roof! There is a high standard on the breakfast, and the nice persons that work there always want to do their best for you. The rooms are good and the roommaids are excellent. Though: The air conditioner did not work properly. It was fixed, but still it was turned off each time we left the room. We therefore had to ask for an extra keycard and leave that in the room. I dont like too much fuss like this. And one of the personel actually told us that the a.c. in several rooms were combined and therefore did not work properly when there is a problem with one of the others. That is not good enough for a hotel with these prices and in a city with 35 C outside! What is also left as neagtive are the persons at the reception desk. They treat you as if they did not care about the guest as they should. I overheard some comments from a guest. I appraciated that he commented in a calm way directly to the receptionist that he was not satisfied and not treated as expected. I did not want to spoil our holiday, and threrefore this is a good opportunity to make my comments. All in all we give this hotel a 3 plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service at checkin and checkout. Beautiful room and restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: GPIngersoll
Reviews.Content: The service upon checkin was superb thanks to the nice young redheaded woman at reception (whose name escapes me) July 25th, 6:30pm. And upon checking out early July 27th, Mr. Yasar Bolat at reception, and bellboy Mr. Guray made sure my early departure to the airport was ontime (0600 am) and even provided some coffee and cookies to get me on my way. Very nice room, housekeeping, and rooftop restaurant. If I'm ever in Istanbul again, I'll stay at the Obelisk. Best, George Ingersoll

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Istanbul at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sue_in_San_Francisc0
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Obelisk is well situated for touring all the historic and cultural sights of Istanbul's Old Town. Rooms are attractive and the roof garden (where breakfast is served) has a fabulous view. Staff is friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel with the terrace restaurant, the food and the front desk staff more than average”
Reviews.Author: solotravellerOkinawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and found it an average hotel in a relatively quiet corner of the touristy Sultanahmet. On the plus side, the rooftop terrace restaurant with a great view of the Bosphorus serves fine food. The front desk staff, particularly Mehmet and his female co-worker, usually on the evening shift, were quite helpful and efficient in catering to my needs. The restaurant, the food and the receptionists made my stay memorable and more than average. One word of caution: beware of the taxi driver who is always waiting for customers in front of this hotel in the morning hours. The car number is 34 TJS 85 and the driver is Hasan Demir, a middle-aged short guy. He speaks English well and looks kind and friendly. In fact, he is phony and approaches to you with a crooked scheme. To be more specific, he tries to rip you off by using a tricky art of replacing your 50-TL bill with his 5-TL bill in the blink of an eye and insist you gave him a wrong bill and that you should give him the right one. I was disgusted with myself , because I easily fell prey to his trick, but I reported this to the local police and the driver ended up in a police cell.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for visiting Istanbuls main sights”
Reviews.Author: s_farquhar
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Plenty of nice restaurants nearby.Excellent location within easy walking distance of 'Blue Mosque', Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Grand bazar. Would definitely recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Istanbal”
Reviews.Author: CeadmileJacksonville
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I had a delightful stay in the centrally located Obelisk Hotel. The hotel provides free pickup service at the airport for 3 night stays. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque and Sofia Hagia, shopping and many wonderful restaurants. The hotel has a nice restaurant on the roof. The staff was very accommodating and the rooms were comfortable and reasonable in price. The hotel also has a spa.

Reviews.Title: “kindly staff”
Reviews.Author: accidentaltourist197
Reviews.Content: Describe the service you experienced - kindly steff Tell us how you liked the room - very comfortably, but actually I don't like the color of bedsheet Talk about the location & amenities - convenient to town(ISTANBUL) Say what you liked best & least a warm and friendly person

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: parsifal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Obelisk for four nights at the beginning of June. It was our first visit to Istanbul and the hotel and staff significantly contributed to our enjoyment of the visit. From the moment of our arrival, the reception staff were welcoming and informative. In fact all the staff; bar, restaurant, porters and cleaners were kind and always ready to help. The location of the hotel (in the heart of Sultanahmet) was excellent and bearing in mind that it was our first visit, an ideal location from which to explore all the main sights. Our room was a good size with a view over the Bosphorous. The public areas were small but inviting particularly the roof terrace which was ideal both for breakfast, an evening drink or a meal. We didnâ€™t sample the food apart from breakfast which had a very good range â€“ fresh orange juice was available for 2TL. The standard of cleanliness was first rate. Overall an excellent hotel with a good atmosphere and location. We wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend it and we would be very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy”
Reviews.Author: wowBangalore
Reviews.Content: very nice cozy hotel,- staff at front office very friendly and helpful, went out of their way to provide us with directions, good food , nice view of the sea from the restaurant. The junior suite provided to us was comfortable, but did have much of a view. Thank you to folks at the front office - Sinan Gam especially. Will be back and stay at the same place. The hotel is superbly located for those who would like to walk around the best landmarks of the city --- hagiya sophia, bluemosque, topkapi, grand bazaar etc etc

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, airconditioning not functioning, lousy view on heap of ruins”
Reviews.Author: reliable66
Reviews.Content: NIce roof terrace, good breakfast, only every day the same and not much choice. For a good nightrest a functionning airconditionner is abolutely necessary. My advise to the hotel would be repair all those airconditionners, because in the room of my friends it did also not function . In despite of our request to repair it, it was not done

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: IndieTraveler53
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and very predictable (not a bad thing when you travel). Breakfast Buffet was very nice with great view of the Blue Mosque. But the room was fairly expensive! But VERY centrally located and they will pick you up at the airport if you stay three nights or more.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location & service”
Reviews.Author: Dana_Romania_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location for anybody who came to Istanbul for tourism but not only: about 10-15 minutes to walk to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia or Topcapi Palace, about 10 minutes to walk to Grand Bazaar, close to the harbour for cruises and not far away from shopping areas like Taksim. The rooms are not luxury but clean and confortable, the breakfast is fair. The service, very good in all Istanbul, is outstanding in this hotel. I came here with my mother and my son to enjoy a longer week-end and we wanted several trips, good restaurants, cruise, etc. The personnel was very helpful and supportive everytime. Not to neglect that the surrounding is very cosy, with many restaurants serving local plates, fish or international dishes, some of them having local live music in the evening although it was not the touristic season. A very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal LocatÄ±on”
Reviews.Author: markoFareham
Reviews.Content: Small frÄ±endly otel Ä±deally sÄ±tuated for all maÄ±n tourÄ±st poÄ±nts. Easy to alk around from here. Staff very very helpful especÄ±ally SÄ±nan Cam on the receptÄ±on desk and BenalÄ± who watches the door and gÄ±ves good recommendatÄ±ons for restaurants. Rooms very good sÄ±ze, nÄ±cely furnÄ±shed Room cleanÄ±ng staff very thorough

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cozy”
Reviews.Author: minoUSA
Reviews.Content: Best Western is situated perfectly behind Blue Mosque and near all the major sights to be seen. The street it is on is itself a quaint street with hotels and restaurants, although it is quiet at night. The service is very nice, and the rooms are charming and clean. The food is okay, and the breakfast buffet does not have as much variety as other Best Westerns I have stayed in. The management is very helpful and personal, and tries to assist you as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjb59
Reviews.Content: Great location all main attractions in walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful. the room was spotlessly clean. Free bottled water provided in the room every day. The retaurant has amazing views; the buffet breakfast was very good and constantly replenished; only minor criticism was that they ran out of tea bags on a few mornings. We had dinner int he restaurant onthe first night and teh food was very good; my partner declared the mixed grill the best he had in Istanbul (he sampled a number!). We took the advice of another reviewer and used www.istanbultour24.com to book transfers to and from the airport - 36 euros return for both of us. Very efficient and you pick the time you want to be picked up.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Wiljo
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the location of the hotel as it is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, trams and various restaurants/cafes. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and spoke good English. Our room was comfortable and clean and well maintained. Good views from the terrace restaurant and it would be very pleasant to have breakfast outside in the summer. The breakfast was good. Our room was near the lift so a little noisy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: JoncoScotland
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff without being too friendly. Very good food including a birthday cake for my wife which was presented on the initive of the hotel staff.Very comfortable rooms. Just could not fault the hotel in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on the doorstep of all the sights”
Reviews.Author: jessanj
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Best Western Obelisk. I booked my package deal through Expedia and had booked the Obelisk on the basis of the reviews I had read on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. Firstly, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. My room was a double superior and was clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet set me up for the day and there was a decent selection of hot foods like eggs, potatoes and cold meats, cheeses, cereals, breads and cakes. The view from the terrace took my breath away as there is an unadulterated sea view plus views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Location wise, you couldn't be better placed. 5 minutes to the Blue Mosque walking and cross over the road to Hagia Sofia. Topkapi can be reached in under 10 mins. I walked to the Bazaar in about 15 minutes. The only thing that bothered me about the hotel is that the walls are really quite thin and I could hear people in the next room talking or taking showers or closing their room doors. The only other irritating thing about the hotel's locality are the local shopkeeper men who insist on luring you into their shops or who walk with you trying to chat you up. They are prevalent on the street leading to the bazaar at the top of the road from the hotel and they congregate around the main tourist sights. It is hard to avoid them and being a solo female traveller, this did put me on edge a little bit. A firm "no" is the best policy but, even then, it is sometimes hard to get this across to them. But this is nothing to do with the hotel which was just perfect. The other tip I can offer is to arrange airport shuttle through Istanbulairport24.com. The Best Western had offered me a pick up from Ataturk to the Hotel for 30 Euros. Istanbulairport24.com offered me a round trip service for 36 Euros which I took and it worked out really well. Enjoy Istanbul. I would definitely go back and I would definitely stay at the Obelisk again.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: jultomte
Reviews.Content: Obelisk is a good basic hotel. Everything works. Breakfast terrace is very fine. From there you can watch the Bosborus and Asian side on Istanbul. Breakfast starts at 7 oÂ´clock but is never ready. Staff takes care of their own breakfast first. If you want to eat the whole variety, itÂ´s better to come later (7.40-). Location is super. All major sights are round the corner. Lots of restaurants are close to the hotel and near tram stop. We were very satisfied with restaurants near tram stop. Food value was good.The fish restaurant 100 meters uphill from the hotel is terrible and very expensive. Ask the price of every item before order.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Doffa
Reviews.Content: We just finishing a three night stay at the Obelisk and we can summarize it as follows: - excellent location (close to restaurants and sights) - cosy room - quiet and safe neighbourhood - friendly and helpful staff - good value for money - breakfast okay

Reviews.Title: “the most amazing rooms, staff and service, nothing was a problem, would return again and again”
Reviews.Author: lorriclark
Reviews.Content: the most lovely hotel, very high standard in our room. the staff are friendly helpful and always smiling......even when you have yet another request. I have stayed in several hotels in this area but found this one the best. very close to the mosque and other amazing sites, just a few mins walk to the heart of the old city...... I would recommend thiis for any traveller as there was a great mix of people staying there. enjoy a turkish bath.....amazing x

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: guccigul
Reviews.Content: the location Ä±s fantastic for all those who wish to wonder the old city. the hotel was great and the staff was even better special sinan bey whom was very helpfel. Thank you to all that played apart Ä±n making our visti such a pleasure. we shall return :)

Reviews.Title: “terrific 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poeme55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 3 stars but it has good service, must of the staff is very polite and very helpfull. The restaurant is on the top terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque, nice view. Breakfast is included and is very well presented with various types of foods to choose from, the bread is fresh daily. Rooms are comfortable and the location is superb, you can walk to the Blue Mosque, to the Bazars near by and the Grand Bazar all within walking distance. The area is very pleasant and has lots of little restaurants and cafes near by, they can also book tours for you and have free airport pick up. We really enjoyed our stay and plan to go back sometime in the near future. They also have turkish bath and massage that you can book while staying.

Reviews.Title: “"The Obelisk is one of the finest of the Great Western chain."”
Reviews.Author: Kneelowe
Reviews.Content: The Obelisk Hotel, an ancient Ottoman mansion set in a quiet square of similar buildings, with its Asian interior design, gives an air of tranquillity and provides a relaxing holiday setting. Our room was spacious and comfortable; and we were provided with the excellent, up-to-date services we expect of a modern luxury hotel. The view of the Sea of Marmara from the terrace restaurant was outstanding. Both the breakfast and dinner menus were superb, and the staff always friendly, most helpful with information about Istanbul. The hotel is within pleasant walking distance of the Sultanahmet Palace, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the bazaars.

Reviews.Title: “the unÄ±que hotel and frÄ±endly employeers”
Reviews.Author: savidov
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Stayed 4 nights with my husband in january and could not have picked a better hotel. Was too nice for the terrace and restaurant did get some good photos from there. Our room was large and spotless. Breakfast was fantastic, but this is not the Holiday Inn, you will not get waffles and cereal. The yogurt at breakfast was the best I have ever eaten. front staff are very helpful and very friendly,especialy I would love to thanks Mr Bolat,he was so kÄ±nd and advise us very nice places,where to go The Best western obelÄ±sk hotel is steps away from the Arasta Bazaar and 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia. Great, great hotel!! if I will come back to Ä°stanbul,definetly I will come the same hotel,I love Ä°stanbul and Obelisk hotel,I recomended to everybody to go there,fell lÄ±ke your owen home

Reviews.Title: “Problem staff - give second thought before you book!”
Reviews.Author: Carottedd
Reviews.Content: 1. Location wise its in the touristy area so within walkable distance to the attractions, all expensive (ripping off prices) stores/restaurants 2.Morning Prayers wake you up every morning at 5ish 6am as its too close to the mosque. 3. The room is cozy for a triple room that we took. Breakfast has reasonable quality with varierites and honey hives. Problem - We were on our way to go out from the hotel to grab some dinner Dec 29, 2009 night. A young male staff stopped us and talked to us , then another mid-aged male staff ( who has previously records) insulted us, as hotel guests ,with horrible words - very very rude words that are offensive. We were furious and asked the floor manager to get us to the hotel manager to report such an incident. Other staff told us this particular staff was crazy. But this is definitely not how guests should be treated so poorly! We demanded to see the hotel manger immediately and so the hotel manager arrived to understand the situation. While being responsive and giving some complientary drinks, the manager was over-friendly and crossed the line as a professional - being flirtacious with words and behavior. Yes, with actions, actions, behaviours. I'll just stop here - thats all I'm gonna say. I wrote my review on booking.com and I was suggested that I should write here to warn more travellers. So, give a second thought before you book. I'm a fair person. Other than the serious people problem, the hardware of the hotel is okay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful holiday and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: s-lin75
Reviews.Content: We have stay in the obelisk hotel 4 nights..the location is very well.. It is close to all major tourist sights. Blue mosgue is just 2 minute by walk..topkapi place and Hagia sophia very near . The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast was good in the terrace restaurant and staff is really friendly The restaurant view is wonderful. From the side terrace, there is a super view of the Blue Mosque.if you needs anythinks you can ask to reception staff..the reception staff is helpfull. *Mr Sinan ,help to me for go to city tour .Mr Yasar help to me for go to Taksim square.Mr Mehmet help to for city information and to go local place.The concierge staff is very kind.Im recommened this hotel for service and for staff..thanks for everyhtinks.I will back again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: laut0022
Reviews.Content: We loved the Obelisk! We spent 7 days in Istanbul for our 2nd anniversary. The location was perfect and we walked to all of the sights, which was a great way to see the city. I arranged for the hotel to pick us up from the airport (free of charge), which worked out perfectly. Unfortunately, due to the disaster that is Turkish Airlines, our luggage did not arrive in Istanbul with us. The hotel was very accommodating and provided my husband with a shaving cream and offered to get us deodorant. We had breakfast on the terrace every morning (free) and found this to be an enjoyable way to start the day. There were a lot of options (although same selection every day) and we loved the view of the MarMara, Blue Mosque, Asia, and Hagia Sophia. We also had dinner one night here and loved the food. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The shower did not drain very well, but this was overlooked by the fact that we had hot water and good water pressure (I've read reviews that other hotels in this area aren't so lucky). We had a great view of the MarMara and the Blue Mosque. We were pretty jet lagged most of the trip (in bed most nights by 8pm), but were never once woken up by street noise. The wi-fi in the room was not the best, but this might be due to the fact that we were on the 3rd floor. I had to sit in front of our door it get decent reception. There was a computer in the lobby that we could have used had we really needed internet. We used the hotel car service to get back to the airport (25 euro). There are cheaper options but we didn't want to roll our luggage on the cobblestone streets to get there or have to be on someone else's schedule. Overall, when we return to Istanbul, I would definitely consider staying at the Obelisk again. However, if we have to fly Turkish Airlines to get there, we might not return.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpexted good service”
Reviews.Author: BorisKarloff
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Obelisk is a well-leaded hotel with very service, in a 10 Minute--footway distance to Blue Mosque and Hagia sophia, The breakfast terrace has a marvellous view on the bosporus, breakfast is better than a in BEST WESTERN US AMERICAN HOtels I tried in June. Due to the mediterranean culture is it is nice to have olives to breakfast. Coffee could be better.The best was that you could be sure that the recommendations you receive by the shift-leader Mr. Bolat are good, not expensive and sure. We decided to take a boat trip on new years eve (31th of Dec), not quiet cheap (150â‚¬(Person) but excellent to have a show on the bosporus. all recommendations were structured and fulfilled a good performance (shuttle inclusive), rooming was great. 60 Minute in hamam--massage SPA was very relaxing. It is worth to be recommened. I will come back

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maartenvr
Reviews.Content: We got a pretty good deal in this hotel in the beginning of december. It is close to all major tourist sights. The rooms are decent and clean. The breakfast was good and as noted earlier the staff is really friendly. Don't forget to eat in the restaurant of the Hotel, it is actually quite good and not that expensive. Just some tips for travellers; - Try to avoid Sultanahmet for eating out if possible (most are to expensive and not that great) - Follow some bargaining classes as its the way to go here - Don't fall for the tricks of shopowners (free tea, come join me i wanna show you something) - Spend a day in Beyogly, do some shopping, see the sights and go eat there, great atmosphere - Food is quite cheap here in Istanbul (15-25 TL) - Alcohol is more expensive (around 5-6 TL for a beer and around 8 TL for wine) - Cigarettes are around 5TL - Instead of a Bosphurus tour, try the Golden Horn tour and get off at Eyup to see a different side of Istanbul (less tourists)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent long-weekend break”
Reviews.Author: TFR-09
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyable stay in a smart hotel, close to the main tourist attractions - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Just a short walk through the picturesque old town area. The reception staff were very helpful and restaurant staff seemed to be genuinely happy at their job. The buffet breakfast was comprehensive and of a high standard. Of the three nights we stayed, the meal in the restaurant (one night) was actually the best. The view from the restaurant over the Sea of Marmara towards the Bosphorus was often obscured by sea mist, but was still impressive. From the side terrace, there is a super view of the Blue Mosque. Although the 5 times a day call to player was very loud in the town, it was unobtrusive in the hotel. Hardly heard from the room. The sea mist caused the nearby lighthouse to sound the foghorn throughout long periods of the night. This didn't bother me, but my partner's sleep was disturbed. The beds were firmer than we are used to. The weather in November was very mild and when the sea mist cleared we enjoyed blue skies and lovely views. Don't miss wandering onto the Galata Bridge over the Golden Horn, and that area of the riverfront. Fantastic atmosphere. The shop proprietors really become a nuisance trying to entice you into their shops or restaurants. Don't fall for the invitation to take a cup of tea in the shop. The friendly facade changes to sulleness when you don't buy. The carpet shops are to be avoided. The quality ceramic decorative plates and vases are beautiful but expensive. Hundreds of UKÂ£s or Euros. Also note that wine in restaurants is expensive everywhere. We only encountered Turkish wine (good quality) but cheapest on the menu is 35 Turkish Lira - about Â£18.00. Very drinkable though! Taxi to and from the Ataturk Airport was 35TL each way. Try not to change currency in the airport - worse rates. If you inquire at the airport information centre about transport to your hotel, they try to sell the dearest possible - don't fall for it, just get a taxi, they have meters.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous experience when we stayed at Obelisk”
Reviews.Author: dalyeuropa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights at Obelisk Istanbul . Had a lovely room and wonderful service throughout. We ate breakfast every day and dinner three times, The servicin the restaurant was superb and the staff all really friendly.We enjoyed the cuisine and local Turkish wines both in hotel and in local restaurants nearby. Managed to visit a lot of interesting historic sites and enjoyed a boat trip on the Bosphorus which enabled us to hear much mora about the history. Most of our shopping was done near the hotel or near the Blue Mosque Bought some beautiful ceramics but no carpets as we do not need these at the moment. Recommend highly Obelisk and all other amenities offered.

Reviews.Title: “Customer care at its best”
Reviews.Author: CRoweLondon
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Istanbul several times on business and have stayed in different hotels. But when I decided take my wife for a short break, I decided to stay in Sultanahmet, which is the historical centre of Istanbul and walking distance from most of the tourist attractions. I did the usual initial internet research and Obelisk Best Western pictures looked good, being recently refurbished. After speaking to Mehmet in reservation and due to his warm manner, we booked in for three days. Throught our stay, we had an excellent service and the cleanliness of the hotel to be admired. The icing on the cake was, when a left behind book was posted to my London office! In summary... Excellent hotel at perfect location with admirable service, A perfect holiday...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for the touristy things to see... nice.”
Reviews.Author: Boink
Reviews.Content: We sure liked this place. As others have written, it's just down the hill (3 blocks?) from the Blue Mosque. We had a Sea of Marmara view room which was adequate... nothing spectacular, but good. The hotel was our first hotel of a Rick Steves Tour, so obviously he thinks it's good. I'm not sure I'd have liked a none-view room. The hotel is a wooden structure and has a WONDERFUL top floor terrace for the morning breakfast, and that breakfast was good. You could sit outside and look at the sea and the Blue Mosque. It's proximity to all the old-town stuff (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topaki Palace was FANTASTIC. You could also easily catch the tram to go almost anywhere else. You could walk to the Grand Market (though a goodly walk). We also eat at a restaurant right nearby (maybe a block away).

Reviews.Title: “Downhill from the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: mjthorntree
