Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old Ottoman town-house located behind the eastern side of the Blue Mosque towards the Sea of Marmara. It is within easy walking distance (5/6 mins) of the Mosque, Sultanahmet Park, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace, but be ready for rough and loosely cobbled streets and pavements that can be quite steep and stepped. Because the hotel is built on a hillside the lobby is below the entrance at street level and the only access is down a staircase. Once inside there is a small lift, frail people might find the outer lift doors fairly heavy to pull outward. The lift ends at the third floor so there is still a staircase to ascend to the roof restaurant/bar/terrace. For these reasons the hotel is not really suitable for disabled persons. The roof terrace has views towards the Blue Mosque higher up the hill but mostly towards the point where the Seaof Marmara narrows to become the Bosphorous, and across the water to the Asian side of Istanbul. My room was along a short corridor off the lobby. Although the view was nothing the poorly maintained building behind the hotel shielded me from railway noise. This was heard in the restaurant but was never obtrusive nor excessive as all trains were travelling slowly to stop/leave a nearby station. As my room was on the opposite side of the hotel to the mosque I was never troubelled by the calls to prayer. The room was adequately furnished, comfortable and kept clean. The bathroom had very modern and probably recent w.c. and an excellent shower easy to operate. You might want to bring a travel plug for the sink. There was a hairdryer and shaver socket. During the tourist day a street further up the hill becomes choked with a long and often stationary line of slowly moving tourist buses heading for Sultanahmet Park to drop off / pick up visitors. If you are using taxis to/from the hotel this can delay your driver and lead to variations in the metered price of the journey. For example a journey to the hotel from Ataturk Airport late on a weekday afternoon was caught up in this jam and cost just under 50 Turkish lira; The return journey the following Sunday just after 0900 hrs was fast undelayed and cost around 37 lira. I ate in the hotel restaurant every evening as I was travelling alone, but there are plenty of alternatives nearby. The restaurant serves mostly Turkish style food but I found the variety and choices very good. It was well prepared and presented and delicious. The two young evening waiters speak excellent English and are very helpful and attentive. Dining was a very pleasant experience. A wide and extensive buffet exists for breakfast, hot and cold, with cold meats and cheese, yoghurt and cereal, bread and cakes (limited choice of jam), fruit juice, tea, coffee. One word of caution if you eat on the terrace, if you put food on a table and leave it unattended, large birds perched watching nearby will swoop down and start to consume it. They particularly like yoghurt and cereal! The hotel has its own Turkish Bath but no pool I would be happy to return again

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tom014
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Obelisk every time I come to Istanbul. I come for a combination of business and pleasure. There are two things I like about the Obelisk, 1) it is in a great location, on a quiet street within walking distance of Sultanahmet tramway and tourist sites, and within a short taxi ride to Pera and Taksim. 2) The hotel is small enough for the staff to get to know you, and they are always helpful, especially the manager, Sinan Cam, who goes out of his way to help the guests. The rooftop restaurant and included breakfast is a great way to start off the day- overlooking the Marmara Sea, and on the other side, the Haghia Sofia and Sultanahmet mosque. It is also a nice way to end the day, and sometimes after an exhausting Istanbul day, I enjoy sitting on the rooftop for the breeze and a chat. The rooms are very nice and clean. Good bathrooms. I do wish they had digital cable, though, even though Eurosport and BBC & CNN are pretty full. The WIFI worked well, and was very useful. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its about location only”
Reviews.Author: Telaga
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of the hotel is its location. As I was in Istanbul with my wife and daughter for sightseeing, it perfectly served our purpose. It is located just a short walk from the key historical attractions of Blue Mosque, Ayasofia and Topkapi palace. You can also stroll along the Bosphorus in the evening and enjoy the cool breeze. Sultanahmet Tramway station and Cankurtaran train stations are within walking distance to allow you to move around the city conveniently. Rooftop restaurant offers nice views of Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. The staff is friendly and cooperative although some of them donâ€™t speak English very well. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and well maintained although the hotel is not really an Ottoman Mansion as advertised. We did not try the restaurant but breakfast is not bad although waitpersons lack motivation. The main entrance into the lobby is by climbing down a small staircase which can be inconvenient for children in baby strollers or the disabled.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerhoo
Reviews.Content: it has a beautiful roof where we had breakfast and see the ocean every morning. The room is OK, not bad. the Breakfast is Turkish and seems a little simple for us. (Actually,it is more or less the same as others) Staff are friendly, warm and humorous. Though it is very closed to the Blue Mosque, it is a bit hard to find it if it is your first time drop into Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “fab location, fab terrace views”
Reviews.Author: FinancialController
Reviews.Content: 3 triple rooms were large enough & clean, half hour from airport was fine, staff heplfull, breakfast had decent variety, good terrace views. Free Intenet, Plenty of see, eat, drink withing walking distance. Blue Mosque 5mins walk, Great Bazzar 10mins, Taksim Square in new city 15mins cab ride approx 15 Turkish Liras Indian restaurant next door has great food. Air Con in rooms was available but not powerfull enought.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff, Well-Appointed, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SpokaneJan09
Reviews.Content: On our first night in Istanbul, what a wonderful haven. Even though the chef had the night off, the waitperson in the terrace restaurant brought us mezas and wine, was so engaging, found a pashima for my shoulders as my husband and I sat out on the terrace, watching the sun go down and the lights of Istanbul come up, especially around the Blue Mosque as we listened the muezzin call for prayer and the seagulls circled the minarets - magic. I also needed to make a couple of calls stateside -- assistance without hesitation. The room was spacious, bed comfortable and AC worked great! Location in Old City was in easy walking distance to all of the major site. Highly recommend this hotel and great value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Terrace Views”
Reviews.Author: mariomom
Reviews.Content: We loved the location and the wonderful terrace in this small, quaint hotel in the historic district. Our room had a beautiful sea view and the usual ammenities you would expect in a hotel in this class. There is an ample breakfast served on the terrace and beautiful views of both the Blue Mosque and Haiya Sophia. Unlike some of the others, we found the front desk and other personnel very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great lÄ±ttle hotel Ä±n old cÄ±ty of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MercatorSarasotaFL
Reviews.Content: My wÄ±fe, Son and Daughter Ä±n law and grandchÄ±ldren ages 16 and 18 spent fÄ±ve days Ä±n thÄ±s hotel Ä±n Istanbul. It has a great locatÄ±on to see the old cÄ±ty and to catch the tram to the new cÄ±ty. SÄ±nan Ã‡am who works the desk gave us excellent restaurant recommendatÄ±ons and helped us wÄ±th cabs, etc. We recommend the place hÄ±ghly. The rooms are modest Ä±n sÄ±ze but well equÄ±ped and the resturant on top of the buÄ±ldÄ±ng has a wonder vÄ±ew and Ä±s a great place for breakfast whÄ±ch Ä±s Ä±ncluded Ä±n the prÄ±ce. A lot of RÄ±ck Steves fans stay here as well as Ä±s tour groupsÃ§

Reviews.Title: “Good location but thin walls and unfriendly front desk personnel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuddy03
Reviews.Content: Location is good...a few blocks from Ayasofia and Blue Mosque. The room was clean and had ample room but the walls are thin and the front desk staff is not friendly. The restaurant on the top floor had good breakfasts, including eggs, meat, yogurt, lots of different types of bread, figs, cereals, and toppings for the yogurt. The "orange juice" was tang and the coffee miserable (weak and stale). The dinner menu is unimaginative and the food was only average. I had a very difficult time getting the front desk to return my emails or requests for information while I was still in the United States. They were no friendlier when I was there in person. They didn't want to exchange currency and were pretty rude about it. They weren't busy so I'm not sure what prompted this...the non manager was more helpful than the manager. My biggest complaint was with the very thin walls. My neighbors heard me sneeze (!) and I could hear their conversations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel SUPER!!!”
Reviews.Author: katyasem
Reviews.Content: obelisk hotel is very very god and all of staf is very very kindly.reception desk is help full and breakfast is nice.the top floor restaurant wonderfull.Im recpmend this hotel.the location is just a few minute away from the central of the historical part.Ä°ts nice stay and I will came to this hotel again..Semenova Ekaterina

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Peter Mills
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to the Obelisk Hotel as a suprise weekend in Istanbul for Valentine's Weekend. The hotel is above average in many ways and it is certainly very well located, just a short stroll from the Blue Mosque and the Ayasofia. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable but our biggest problem was with the terrible soundproofing. We were given room 319 on the top floor but were kept awake as it is right under the bar/restaurant on the roof terrace. The music stopped at about midnight but then we had the sound of furniture being moved (presumably for breakfast) for the next hour and a half. The noise started again at 6am as they started breakfast! We had had enough and so asked to be moved to a lower floor, which they did without question (they admitted that lots of people complain about the noise), although we still heard noise from the room above. I think the hotel is just very poorly soundproofed, so be sure to take ear plugs! The breakfast was fairly good, although the coffee was some of the worst I have ever tasted (surprising in Turkey!) and the orange juice was not fresh. The shortcomings were more than made up for by the wonderful view out over the Bospheros. Although it was not perfect, the Obelisk was still a good base to explore Istanbul, just make sure you don't get a room on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in tourist center of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: BeboAndBebo
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a tourist center of Istanbul.Everything is near,walking distance I may say.Historical scene are on 5 minute walk.Personal is very friendly.They all speak good english and they are very helpful.The massge,sauna and turkish bath are great.The massuist is a ukraine lady and she is a goddess If you go to Istanbul to see Historical places this is yout hotel!!! Very best.Best western!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to see historic sights. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Shaieb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just been refurbished. We booked with Last minute.com and were very pleased. The pictures on the hotel website do not do the place justice. All rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable with 24" Phillips flat screen tvs. The mattress's are on the firm side, but thats the way we like it. I booked two rooms, a triple and a double, both were standard rooms. The triple ended up being a mini suite with a sofa bed convereted into a 3rd bed. Perfect for our little baby. Our room was very clean. The hotel is less than 3 min walk to the Blue Mosque. 5 mins to Haga Sofia and approx 12 mins to Topkapi palace. Breakfast is served on the terrace floor and it was an excellent selection of food... though not too many cakes / sweets. Last minute.com classified this hotel as 3 star. i would classify it as 4 star. Having spent a lot of time in hotels I would def say this is a 3+ star hotel. List of minor gripes.. The air con did not work in the double room on the 1st night, however a word with reception got this fixed. The water in our room cut out at 2am. Again a quick call to reception resolved this. The lift in the hotel is very small. Not good if you have a big pram. However the hotel is on 3 main floors so using the stairs is possible so long as someone can help with prams / buggies. I went to the resteraunt several times to heat up baby food and they were very kind / helpful. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Recently Renovated - Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Quenton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing a renovation and it's almost completed. We stayed there as part of a tour group from the U.S. The hotel is in the Old District of Istanbul just a short walk from the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Haia Sophia. However, don't waste $$ on a Sea View Room unless you get to see it beforehand. I paid for 2 SeaView Rooms - both were blocked by trees somewhat. Not worth an additional $70 per night. Also be aware that cab drivers are notorious for trying to rip hotel guests off here. Apparently their meters can be set to charge a 30% premium (night time rate) and many cab drivers try to charge this. It happened twice to me and to another person while staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paper-thin walls - very very noisy”
Reviews.Author: marko-100
Reviews.Content: Great location and nice rooms at a good price - but be warned: don't stay there if you want to get a good night's sleep! I was there three terrible, sleep deprived, nights - making it difficult to really enjoy the glories of Istanbul. The walls were paper-thin, meaning that you could hear every cough, word, knock, snore, wheeze, flush etc from the rooms either side, the hall way and the rooms above. No matter how inexpensive the hotel is, I do not expect having to listen to people in the rooms around me talking or going to the toilet! It is a shame as the hotel itself is nice, well located and has quite pleasant staff - I would recommend looking for alternative accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, homey hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenHF
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the Obelisk Hotel staff for making me feel so at home during my 8-night stay in Istanbul October 17-25, 2007. Sinan Cam and Mehmet Aycicek at the front desk were especially helpful, friendly, and professional. My room was comfortable and cleaned spotless every day. The breakfast buffet was fresh and plentiful with tasty Turkish offerings; my favorites were juicy tomatoes, crunchy cucumbers, goat cheese, and black olives along with Turkish apricots, yogurt and rose jam on still-warm fresh bread. Best of all, the rooftop terrace has been expanded since my last visit, and now offers views not only of the Sea of Marmara but the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia as well. On some mornings, as I kept drinking my bottomless cup of high-octane Turkish tea, it was hard to leave my rooftop breakfast table because the sunrise views over this incredible city were so spectacular. Thanks again â€“ Iâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: cooltradewinds
Reviews.Content: Pat from England - Very friendly, helpful staff and a lovely comfortable room with a sea view made our stay in Istanbul a great experience. We stayed for a week and enjoyed all the famous sights which were all a 5 minute walk from the hotel, such as the Aya Sofia, the Cistern (our favourite), the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and much more. We also loved to walk about in the area around the hotel , the cobbled streets with great eating places, Bazaars and shops - calm after the hectic busy city. The hotel had free tea, coffee etc. in the lounge downstairs and free internet access as well. Typical Best Western however, you have to ask at the desk for your shower cap and sewing kit etc. !! An excellent and very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but with some problems!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinEssex
Reviews.Content: Good points - excellent location, lovely terrace (Blue Mosque is very close), good room size, excellent air conditioning, cleaning team excellent - room always kept clean. Small fridge with reasonably priced drinks. Free internet in reception area was very useful. Ideally located for main Istanbul attractions - all walking distance. Poor points - Not many sockets in room (electrics looked a bit dodgy), no coffee facilities, shower not great, bathroom extractor did not work, sink plug did not work (really - with the plug firmly in, the water still escaped the sink!), bed noisy, bathroom lock did not work. TV was provided but hotel channel selection was poor. Hotel bar closes early - no coffee facilities for evening drinks on lovely terrace. Watch out for Hotel's 'collect from airport' service. It must be cash, is expensive (twice as much as a taxi) and we had to wait half an hour for another person. then we had to wander around airport to car park area to get into small Fiat. So, slower and more expensive. Reception staff were abrupt and rude when we asked for fee to go on credit card. This hotel is promoted as a 3 star. Not sure about that, 2 star might be a bit harsh, so 2 and a half star would be fair.
